name: Allies
description:
• You can cultivate mortal Allies who help you unknowingly as a vampire.
  • Allies may assist you occasionally, but maintain their own lives.
  • Build a balanced relationship; help them in return for better support.
  • Each Ally can be used once per game session.
  • Ally levels:
    • Level 1: Weak mortal - pool of 3 in specialization, 4 Health levels.
    • Level 2: Average mortal - pool of 5 in specialization, 5 Health levels.
    • Level 3: Gifted mortal - pool of 7 in specialization, 6 Health levels.

advantages.name: At Arm's Length
advantages.description:
• Operate indirectly with your Ally using various measures.
  • Attempts to uncover your connection require a Downtime Action and an Intelligence + Investigation test (Difficulty 5).
  • Cannot combine this Advantage with the Retainer Advantage.

advantages.name: Diversity
advantages.description:
• Ally's diverse interests expand expertise across multiple Spheres of Influence.
  • Level 1: Ally can help in two Spheres of Influence.
  • Level 2: Ally can help in three Spheres of Influence.

advantages.name: Reliable
advantages.description:
• Cultivated Allies are more reliable, prioritize you, and expect favors in return.
  • Level 1: Ally takes half the time of a standard Ally for tasks (time determined by Storyteller).
  • Level 2: Ally prioritizes you over others, completes tasks in one-third the time (time determined by Storyteller).

advantages.name: Retainer
advantages.description:
• Your Ally becomes a ghoul, fully Blood Bound to you.
  • They no longer request favors in return for their services.
  • They can perform tasks within the supernatural world and don't breach the Masquerade.
  • They gain two level-one Discipline powers from your in-clan Disciplines.
  • If purchased by another character as an Ally, that character loses access to the NPC.

advantages.name: Flaky
advantages.description:
• Your Ally is skilled but unreliable, often failing to meet deadlines.
  • Level 1: Ally takes twice as long as a standard Ally to complete tasks.
  • Level 2: Ally demands payment and may renegotiate for increased payment mid-task.

advantages.name: Conspiracy Theorist
advantages.description:
• Your Ally is a conspiracy theorist, often believing in the unbelievable.
  • They may share unusual theories, including supernatural creatures.
  • Caution is needed to avoid Masquerade breaches, as they are watchful for evidence of their theories.

name: Familiar
description:
• Your Familiar is a ghoul animal, controlled through Animalism or training.
  • Size and traits depend on the Familiar's level:
    • Level 1: Small (bird or cat), 2 Health levels, Physical test pools of 3, Mental and Social test pools of 1.
    • Level 2: Medium-sized (dog or wolf), 4 Health levels, Physical test pools of 5, Mental and Social test pools of 1.
    • Level 3: Large (bear or tiger), 6 Health levels, Physical test pools of 7, Mental and Social test pools of 1.
  • You can choose a higher-level companion of a smaller size.
  • Choose one Discipline (Celerity, Potence, or Fortitude) for your Familiar, which gains both level-one powers of that Discipline.

name: Contacts
description:
• Contacts are professional connections for information.
  • They share insider knowledge and rarely ask for favors.
  • Use them for insights within their Sphere(s) or receive calls about intriguing matters.
  • Level 1: Low-level employee, general insider knowledge.
  • Level 2: Middle management, access to hidden information, some influence.
  • Level 3: Senior management, access to sensitive information, significant influence.

advantages.name: At Arm's Length
advantages.description:
• Operate indirectly with your Contact using various measures.
  • Attempts to uncover your connection require a Downtime Action and an Intelligence + Investigation test (Difficulty 5).
  • Cannot combine this Advantage with the Retainer Advantage.

advantages.name: Diversity
advantages.description:
• Contact's diverse interests expand expertise across multiple Spheres of Influence.
  • Level 1: Contact can help in two Spheres of Influence.
  • Level 2: Ally can help in three Spheres of Influence.

advantages.name: Paranoid
advantages.description:
• Paranoid Disadvantage affects your Contact's behavior.
  • Level 1: Contact frequently changes phones, causing a minimum 2-day delay in communication.
  • Level 2: Contact insists on in-person meetings at different locations, causing at least a 2-week delay in communication.

name: Fame
description:
• Famous in a specific Sphere of Influence.
  • Recognition and favors likely within that Sphere.
  • +1 to mundane Social challenges per Fame dot.
  • Increased visibility but also potential drawbacks.
  • Levels: Level 1 - Some recognition; Level 2 - Local following; Level 3 - Citywide recognition.

advantages.name: Fan Club
advantages.description:
• You have a dedicated Fan Club who assists when encountered.
  • Once per session, you can request a reasonable favor from them.
  • Encounters are at the Storyteller's discretion and depend on your rising Fame level.

advantages.name: Star Power
advantages.description:
• Additional Fame extension for broader recognition.
  • Requires Fame level 3 and Storyteller approval.
  • Level 1: Recognized in your state or region.
  • Level 2: Globally famous, with worldwide recognition.

advantages.name: Jealousy
advantages.description:
• Fame brings envy and enemies who want to see you fail.
  • Level 1: A group dislikes you in one Sphere of Influence, no Contacts or Allies allowed.
  • Level 2: In addition to Level 1, those outside your Connections hate you and act negatively; enemies are always available.

advantages.name: Paparazzi
advantages.description:
• Overzealous fan clubs create persistent followers who track your every move.
  • They take photos for magazines, causing complications when staying under the radar.
  • Storyteller determines specific issues and complications arising from this Disadvantage.
